key_points: Brian Laundrie flew to Florida from Salt Lake City on Aug. 17 and returned six days later during a road trip with Gabby Petito.
Laundrie returned home on Sept. 1 without Petito, driving her 2012 Ford Transit; he has been named a 'person of interest' in her disappearance.
Gabby Petito, who went missing during the trip, was confirmed dead, found in Bridger-Teton National Forest, Wyoming.
Laundrie's family attorney confirmed the flight details, stating the purpose was to save money for extending their road trip.
Laundrie's sister, Cassie, pleads for him to surrender to police, claiming no knowledge of his whereabouts.
Cassie's last interaction with Brian was on Sept. 6 during a family visit, describes it as 'ordinary'.
New Moab Police body camera footage released, showing interaction between police, Petito, and Laundrie on Aug. 12.
In the footage, Petito describes Laundrie grabbing and scratching her face; she acknowledged hitting him first.
The couple was stopped by Moab, Utah police after a witness reported a domestic violence incident.
A nationwide manhunt for Brian Laundrie continues, intensifying the case's attention.
